items.title: Best, worst of NFL Week 4: Packers tie Cowboys in OT thriller, plus Chiefs win big over Ravens
items.summary: Our NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 4.

items.title: Cowboys vs. Packers ends in overtime stalemate — Is it time to rework OT rules?
items.summary: A 40–40 thriller between Dallas and Green Bay ended in a tie, reigniting debate over whether the NFL should adopt college football’s overtime format to ensure every contest has a winner.

items.title: Week 4 INSTANT fantasy takeaways: Cowboys-Packers tie, Dart wins debut and Jeanty breaks out
items.summary: Matt Harmon and Chris Allen recap a wild Week 4 in the NFL by providing their biggest instant fantasy takeaways from all the action on the Sunday slate. The two place games in three fantasy buckets: Games we care about the most, games we sort of care about and games that could have been an email. But first, Harmon recaps the Packers-Cowboys SNF game and provides the biggest fantasy storylines from the primetime affair.

items.title: When was the Packers' last tie before Sunday's 40-40 game vs Cowboys? Packers tie history, NFL overtime rules
items.summary: A tie is rare in Green Bay Packers history but it has happened before. Here's a look back at how Sunday's game ended in a tie.

items.title: Colts WR Mitchell on blown TD, fumble: 'It stings'
items.summary: Colts young WR Adonai Mitchell took ownership of a pair of costly mistakes in Indianapolis' first loss of the season.

items.title: NFL Week 4 INSTANT reactions: Cowboys-Packers tie?? Ravens panic mode? Steelers black magic

items.title: Ashton Jeanty proves Ryan Clark wrong in big way with Week 4 performance

items.title: AD Mitchell’s miscues, Colts’ mistakes played major role in loss to Rams
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – It was a typical NFL game, this one involving 154 plays. “One play doesn’t define any ballgame,’’ insisted Daniel Jones Sunday evening at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, Ca. But a few of those plays were more consequential than others and were unquestionably defining as Jones his Indianapolis Colts saw their 3-0 start interrupted [...]

items.title: Multiple AD Mitchell Mishaps Loom Large in Loss to Rams
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts had just retaken the lead late in the form of an electric, 76-yard touchdown reception from Daniel Jones to AD Mitchell, except they didn’t. They actually turned the ball over, and it wasn’t anything the Los Angeles Rams defense did. Unfortunately for Colts fans, this is far too familiar a mishap. AD […]

items.title: Colts can’t overcome AD Mitchell’s egregious mistakes in close, 27-20, road loss to Rams
items.summary: There’s the old sports saying that “good teams don’t beat themselves,” but that’s exactly what the Indianapolis Colts did in the second half during a 27-20 tough road loss to the Los Angeles Rams. The main culprit of the late West Coast afternoon loss was talented, but clearly still maturing 2nd-year wideout AD Mitchell—who had […]

items.title: Colts show they can hang with Super Bowl-contending Rams, but left to lament 11 penalties, 3 turnovers in Week 4 loss

items.title: As Adonai Mitchell owns 'unacceptable' mistake, Colts stand by second-year WR: 'One play doesn't define you'
items.summary: Mitchell said he lost focus on his fumble that turned a 76-yard touchdown into possession for the Los Angeles Rams.

items.title: Colts stunned by Rams to suffer first loss in another epic collapse
items.summary: The promising bid for a statement road win unraveled in the second half as the Indianapolis Colts were stunned by the Los Angeles Rams in Sunday’s 27-20 loss at SoFi Stadium. The Colts fell apart once again in perhaps the worst team performance since the late 2024 season collapse at Mile High and the Meadowlands. […]

items.title: Miscues down the Colts against the Rams
items.summary: Stunned. Many moments of frustration and disappointment, but two moments stand out as truly stunning; one beyond belief. The Indianapolis Colts gave everything the Los Angeles Rams could handle and still head home with a loss. It was always going to be a tough game. That was clear from the beginning. A loss here isn’t […]

items.title: Colts lose to Rams, 27-20, drop to 3-1 on the season
items.summary: LOS ANGELES — Mistakes doomed the Colts on Sunday at SoFi Stadium. Indianapolis lost to the Los Angeles Rams, 27-20, and fell short of securing their first 4-0 start to a season since 2009. Miscues from wide receiver Adonai Mitchell negated two Colts touchdowns on the contest. The first of Mitchell's errors came with 11:32 [...]

items.summary: In the Colts first game outside of the Midwest this season, they take on a Rams coming off of a brutal collapse vs the defending Champion Eagles. items.title: Introducing Indianapolis Colts Fall Fests

Colts Fall Fests are scheduled for Saturday, Sept. 27, at Lark Ranch in Greenfield and Saturday, Oct. 18, at Russell Farms in Noblesville. Attendees will find a number of activities, including Colts-themed giveaways, appearances and entertainment along with pumpkin [...]

items.summary: Los Angeles Rams quarterback Matthew Stafford is in his 17th season in the NFL, and when he takes the field against the Colts on Sunday at SoFi Stadium he'll do with having thrown for 60,548 yards and 382 touchdowns in his spectacular career.

items.title: Colts' Taylor again named AFC Offensive Player of the Week
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – It happened again. For the second week in a row, Indianapolis Colts running back Jonathan Taylor is the AFC Offensive Player of the Week. items.title: Colts likely without Alec Pierce, Kenny Moore II at Rams
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The Indianapolis Colts likely will be without two key players as they attempt to remain unbeaten Sunday against the Los Angeles Rams. Wide receiver Alec Pierce is in the NFL’s concussion protocol, while cornerback Kenny Moore II is dealing with an Achilles injury. Neither will practice on Wednesday. That normally is significant with [...]

items.title: Reggie Wayne, Adam Vinatieri headline Colts’ contingent seeking spot in Pro Football Hall of Fame
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Seven Indianapolis Colts, including several franchise icons, are among the 128 Modern-Era candidates for the Pro Football Hall of Fame’s Class of 2026. At the top of the list, which was released Wednesday morning, are wide receiver Reggie Wayne and placekicker Adam Vinatieri, and they’re joined by two other long-time club standouts: defensive end Robert Mathis and center Jeff Saturday.
